content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.95 - Executive Order No. 95: Establishing the Task Force on School Violence. [DAGGER]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, the level of violence perpetrated and experienced
by students in our school as continued to escalate; WHEREAS, students, parents, teachers and administrators
have real and justifiable fears concerning the safety of their schools; and
WHEREAS, in addition to putting the physical safety of
children, teachers and other school personnel at risk, violent and disruptive
pupils deprive other students of the opportunity to learn in an environment
which is safe and conducive to education; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and

Laws of the State of New York, do hereby establish the Task Force on School

Violence. The Task Force on School Violence (Task Force) shall
consist of the Lieutenant Governor, who shall serve as Chair, the Director of

Criminal Justice, the Superintendent of the New York State Police, the

Commissioner of Education, The Commissioner of the Office of Children &
Family Services, the Commissioner of the Office of Mental Health, and the

Executive Director of the Council on Children and Families, or their designees. Additional Task Force members shall be appointed by the Governor and shall
include representatives from the public and private sectors with expertise in
addressing the issue of violence in schools and communities. Members of the

Task Force shall include school administrators and educators, including
superintendents, principals, and teachers, as well as law enforcement
personnel, parents, students and experts in the fields of adolescent health and
safety and juvenile justice. The members of the Task Force, who shall be
appointed by the Governor and serve at his pleasure, shall receive no
compensation but shall be entitled to reimbursement for any necessary expenses
incurred in connection with the performance of their duties. The Task Force shall study and report to the Governor on a
practical plan of action to address the growing trend of violence and
disruptive conduct in our schools and to promote a safe learning environment
for all children and school personnel. In performing this work, the Task Force
shall solicit the views and concerns of parents, teachers, students, school
administrators, school boards, medial and mental health professionals, and

State and local law enforcement agencies. Additionally, the Task Force shall
consult with appropriate departments, divisions and units of State and local
government. The Task Force is hereby authorized to call upon any
agency, department, office, division, or public authority of this State to
supply it with such data and other resources, personnel and assistance as the

Task Force deems necessary to discharge the responsibilities conferred upon it
by this Order. Each agency, department, office, division, and public authority
of this State is hereby required to cooperate with the Task Force and to
furnish to the Task Force such information, personnel, and assistance as the

Task Force deems necessary to accomplish the purposes of this Order. The Task Force shall be dissolved 90 days after the
completion of its report. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: April 15, 1999
